item.title: Nvidia Driver Installation
item.description: Install Nvidia Driver By Repository Install Nvidia Driver By Run File Install Nvidia Driver By Repository Add non-free Debian repository # Debian Bullseye deb http://deb.debian.org/debian/ bullseye main contrib non-free # Debian Bullseye Backports deb http://deb.debian.org/debian bullseye-backports main Update all packages to latest version sudo apt-get update Install Nvidia Drivers # Install nvidia driver from main repository sudo apt-get install nvidia-driver nvidia-smi # Install nvidia driver from back-ports sudo apt-get install -t bullseye-backports nvidia-driver nvidia-smi Install Nvidia Driver By Run File Download linux driver from Nvidia

item.title: Hard Disk Information
item.description: smartctl lshw lsblk blkid hdparm fdisk with grep smartctl sudo smartctl -i /dev/sdx lshw The tool lshw provides detail information on the hardware configuration of the machine. Additional flags (ie class) can be used to filter output. sudo lshw -short -class disk sudo lshw -short -class disk -class storage lsblk lsblk /dev/sdx blkid blkid hdparm sudo hdparm -I /dev/sda fdisk with grep fdisk -l | grep '^Disk /dev/' fdisk -l | grep '^Disk /dev/' | egrep -v '/dev/(loop|mapper|md)'

item.title: Usermod Command
item.description: Usermod Options Usermod Examples Change User Home Directory Change User Primary Group Adding Group to an Existing User Change User Login Name Move User Home Directory to New location Change User Shell Change User and Group ID For User Usermod Options -d: Directory Path -g: Primary Group -G: Adding Supplementary Group to Existing User -l: New Login -d: Directory Path -m: Home Directory -s: Shell Path Usermod Examples Change User Home Directory sudo usermod -d /var/www/ username Change User Primary Group sudo usermod -g groupname username Adding Group to an Existing User sudo usermod -G supgroup username Change User Login Name sudo usermod -l new_username username Move User Home Directory to New location sudo usermod -d /directory/path -m username Change User Shell sudo usermod -s /bin/sh username Change User and Group ID For User sudo usermod -u 888 -g 999 username
